description: This course entails a careful reading of the Iliad and Odyssey - two of the earliest and most
influential epics of human history - with attention to their Greek historical and cultural
contexts.  The course then explores some of the many reincarnations of Homer's epics in later
generations, from Monteverdi's opera Return of Ulysses to David's painting Anger of Achilles to
the Coen brothers' film O Brother, Where Art Thou?  Offered periodically during January term.
